intro: Diasperus cornutus, commonly known as the horned dandelion, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow composite flowers. The plant has a basal rosette of leaves and produces slender, hairy stems that support its flowering heads. Its fruit is a small, spiny achene that is often dispersed by wind. Diasperus cornutus is adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
